## PBRBlockNode.validate() method

Validates the node state

**Signature:**

```typescript
protected validate(): string;
```
**Returns:**

string

Empty string (always valid)

## Remarks

The PBR output node is always valid because: - All inputs are optional (have default values) - Type conversions are handled automatically (float â†’ vec3, etc.) - It's the terminal node with no type inference requirements
